actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House of observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the Apalachee High School shooting.
Mr. LaMalfa asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on September 12. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 269
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9456 — "To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 with respect to foreign investments in United States agriculture, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 237
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Veasey moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1398 — "To establish the CCP Initiative program, and for other purposes."
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of XIX, the House proceeded with further consideration of H.R. 1398.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 219
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 202

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Lee (CA) moved to recommit to the Committee on Foreign Affairs.
The House adopted the amendment as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 1425.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 403
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 409).
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1425 — "To require any convention, agreement, or other international instrument on pandemic prevention, preparedness, and response reached by the World Health Assembly to be subject to Senate ratification."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 1425 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Davidson moved that the committee rise.
On agreeing to the Massie amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1430, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Massie amendment No. 3.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Massie,  numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 118-656 to add to the findings of Congress an outline of the constitutional role for the legislative and executive branches in the treaty-making process.
On agreeing to the Foxx amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1430, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Foxx amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Foxx,  numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report 118-656 to clarify that no WHO convention, agreement, or treaty should have force or effect in U.S. law before or unless the Senate ratifies said treaty.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Ogles demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1430, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-656 to offer a statement of policy in support of Taiwan's full participation at the World Health Organization.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 1425.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jefferson Van Drew to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1430 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1398, H.R. 1425, H.R. 1516, H.R. 7980, H.R. 9456 and H.R. 9494. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1398, H.R. 1425, and H.R. 1516 under a structured rule and H.R. 7980, H.R. 9456, and H.R. 9494 under a closed rule. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1430. H.R. 1425 — "To require any convention, agreement, or other international instrument on pandemic prevention, preparedness, and response reached by the World Health Assembly to be subject to Senate ratification."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 9456, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Lucas demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Takano moved to recommit to the Committee on Financial Services.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 9456.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1398, H.R. 1425, H.R. 1516, H.R. 7980, H.R. 9456 and H.R. 9494. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1398, H.R. 1425, and H.R. 1516 under a structured rule and H.R. 7980, H.R. 9456, and H.R. 9494 under a closed rule. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1430. H.R. 9456 — "To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 with respect to foreign investments in United States agriculture, and for other purposes."
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 7032. Senate agreed to H. Con. Res. 124 and H. Con. Res. 126.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Davis of NC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ralph Norman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
